articles.title: Free Beer! Budweiser gives Argentina the world cup’s left-over beer free to Argentina fans
articles.description: For its distribution, Budweiser has set up delivery points across the country, forming part of its #BringHomeTheBud campaign. Interested fans need to fill out a form and redeem it at these outlets.
articles.content:
During the Qatar world cup, the sponsor Budweiser said that it will give away all the beer it can’t sell in the stadiums to the eventual World Cup winners.

articles.title: ‘Vulgar Clown’, ‘Stupid’: Patrick Vieira and Souness blast Emiliano Martinez, Argentina’s goalkeeper
articles.description: An official complaint was also launched by France against Argentina’s Emiliano Martinez for brutally trolling Kylian Mbappe post the final between Argentina and France.
articles.content: Condemnation keeps coming for the Golden Glove winning Argentine goalkeeper Emiliano ‘Dibu’ Martinez for his reactions after winning the world cup. It was two-pronged: trolling Kylian Mbappe and a lewd gesture just after he received the Golden Glove ... [2076 chars]

articles.title: Conte not happy about quick Premier League restart
articles.description: Out of the 12 Tottenham players who featured in Qatar, Conte has ruled France goalkeeper Hugo Lloris and Argentina's Cristian Romero, who played in the final last Sunday, out of Monday's game.
articles.content:
Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte is “not really happy” that the Premier League will resume just eight days after the World Cup and hinted he might rest players for the Boxing Day match at Brentford.

articles.description: Zimbabwe, Turkey, Argentina, Pakistan and Nigeria all have presidential or general elections in 2023.
